website_summaries.verdict: Gourmet coffee lovers looking for an alternative to the French press will be impressed by the AeroPress's ease of use and strong brews. Includes a nylon tote bag for travel.
pros: Micro-filter retains more grounds than French press
Performs both standard and espresso coffee extractions
cons: Seals can degrade and leak over time
Rubber seals create sticky residue under heat

customer_reviews.title: Buy a regular coffee press!
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing more than a cheaper plastic version of a coffee press that costs more and has consumables that you need to buy. It DOES NOT make anything close to an espresso style coffee and it is nothing but difficult to use. I bought this with the intention of using it in a pinch or while on vacation...after many attempts to make a drinkable coffee with it, today it went right in the bin! Wish I had my $30 back. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!
customer_reviews.author: John I. Mielke

customer_reviews.title: Amazing brewer. Simply amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I find exactly zero faults with this. Seriously. None. I use this thing to make iced lattes nearly every day. Let's go through it: Brewing: super simple. Add filter. Add coffee. Add water. Stir. Plunge directly into cup. Flavor: I'm using a Columbian medium roast and it's perfect. As strong or as weak as you like it, I grew it super-strong because reasons. Cleanup: pop the filter/grinds into the trash/compost, quick rinse. It's super easy. I just bought a second one to take to work. Value: it's only $35. Oh, and it's made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: I don’t get the hype...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of all of the 4-5 star ratings. I don’t understand the hype. I have tried multiple times with various coffee beans, extra filters and amounts of coffee and it’s just not that good. The water doesn’t stay in the grounds long enough to really extract flavor. This is going in the donate pile. I’m going back to a true pour-over.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: I was hooked and it's ideal for busy people
customer_reviews.text: This thing really does make excellent coffee, smooth and bold. I have been using one for years now. If you just like a really good 'Americano' and you are not too bothered about home-made cappuccino's this will save you an utter fortune. I buy beans, grind them fresh, make the coffee. It's also really easy to clean, especially compared to a cafetière or coffee machine, you just eject a compressed coffee disc, and give the rubber plunger a quick rinse under the tap.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the office!
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these at home. When I'm up early its nice to brew a cup of coffee without using my Nespresso Machine because it is noisy. The AeroPress is silent and makes the perfect cup of coffee. Somewhere between drip coffee and French press, its actually my favorite way to brew. I bought this one to keep at work because it is so simple to make and clean up. You can literally just pop the disk and ground straight into the trash when you are done and throw it back in the drawer, you can even get away with not rinsing if you are in a hurry!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D

customer_reviews.title: Finally a full mug!
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to land on a solid recipe, but I like a clean cup and here's what I've been doing to get a full mug: Inverted method 24g fresh ground coffee (finer than pour over, coarser than espresso) 2 filters 30s bloom 220g total water at 206° 2min steep Slow press until hiss 150g dilution This gives me a not-super-oily cup with no grit and it's easily repeated. I like light to medium roast coffee with this recipe.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blough

customer_reviews.title: My EU company is the 2015 world champion in brewing coffee with Aeropress. Are you giong to be the next?
customer_reviews.text: One of the best coffee makers out there. It is very versatile and there are unlimited options to make coffee. I love that there is also a world championship in preparing coffee in Aeropress and the recipes of the winners are public, but take these as inspiration and develop your own. With my coffeeI like to use the 3x30 sec method. Grind your coffee little bit finer then you would do it for filter coffee and follow the 3x30 second rule. 30 second blooming 30 second brewing 30 second pushing have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Baby Bee

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, many parts
customer_reviews.text: Makes good coffee. The plunger has strong resistance, which makes me nervous about potential burns. It’s not like there is a way to securely connect it to a coffee cup. If you’re traveling, you need a separate cup to heat the water in. I’m a traveler, so this is somewhat inconvenient. This comes with many parts (most of them are unnecessary). The parts don’t all fit together in one compact little setup, which is unfortunate. I haven’t really had it long enough to really rate its durability. It does make good coffee. But so do competitors who have better designs (with travel in mind).
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Meador

customer_reviews.title: I just like coffee
customer_reviews.text: I'm no coffee buff, I bought this for camping and ended up hooked on it! I use it everyday to brew a fresh cup of coffee and at the office. Im blown away how something so simple works so well but it does. Watch a YouTube vid, pitch the instructions their junk. Many ways to brew but the easiest one I think is pop a scoop in pour water in slowly to 4. Out in plunger and let it sit for 30 secs then plunge slowly and it's a smooth full flavor every cup.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C

customer_reviews.title: Coffee leaks up the sides
customer_reviews.text: I used to love my aeropress. This is my second one. The first one cracked a bunch after 3 years of use and I worried about plastic breaking down, so I bought a new one 2 years ago. I followed the directions and emptied the coffee and rinsed it off immediately after use, though that's hard to do because it is hot. But very quickly after owning this new one the coffee began leaking up when pushing the aeropress plunger down. It's progressively gotten worse and is pretty much useless now. It's expensive to buy a new one every 1 or 2 years so I guess I'll need to go a different route now!
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Excellent brew, fast, easy, and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: OMG!! Where the heck have I been for years?? Can't believe that I am just now learning about this awesome brewer. It is SOOO easy to use but the important part is it makes a DELICIOUS cup of coffee every time!! And it is inexpensive as well compared to other coffee brewing tools. We were a Keurig family for a long time, mostly due to the convenience, but after making about 6 cups with the Aeropress and timing them, the extra small bit of time is WELL WORTH the fantastic, flavorful result. Needless to say, the Keurig machine was removed from the counter 24 hours later and we cut open the remaining coffee pods to use in the Aeropress!!
customer_reviews.author: rswaz

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty sure this is counterfeit. I have one that is 5 years old and it looks different and works better. This one has a flimsy seal, there isn’t enough pressure and over all size seems different. I’m returning it and buying from an authorized online dealer which this one isn’t
customer_reviews.author: Yoga girl

customer_reviews.title: Everything that I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: After listening to Matt Farah about this item, I've decided to get one. I've ordered this one with the blue head accessory with mesh reusable filter. Here my thoughts after having it for over 1 week. Pros- 1. Make very stronger espresso coffee. Close to a mechine without the bitterness at the end. 2.Make faster coffee then my kurig machine. 3. Easy to operate and good fan base for new recipes. Cons- 1. Cleaning ,but then again when was that easy with ground coffee beans🤪 . Enjoy and remember you can use this one for camping which is a major plus and for that reason alone worth having it.
customer_reviews.author: Obarel

customer_reviews.title: The attachment that holds the coffee grounds does not stay attached
customer_reviews.text: The attachment that holds the coffee grounds does not stay attached. Potentially this could be a great item, but whenever I screw on the cup that holds the coffee and proceed to make my cup of coffee, the attachment always falls off in the process. Yes, I am putting it on right. The suction/pressure/vacuum created by the channel/tube/funnel is greater than the screw on cap.
customer_reviews.author: WelcoJoe

customer_reviews.title: It works, but I think its over hyped.
customer_reviews.text: Too many variables to nail a cup of coffee. Yet with patience, it will probably do the job. Easy to clean, much more so than traditional french press. Needs hot (185+) water to maintain temps through brewing process.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe it took me so long to get an Areopress
customer_reviews.text: I'm really into great tasting medium and light roast coffees. I never pre-grid and I always use a scale, timer, and thermometer when making my coffee. It used to take me 10-15 minutes of focused work to brew my morning coffee and I used a hand grinder to make sure I got an even medium/course grind for my pour over. Now - with the Areopress I get reliably delicious coffee in 4-5 Min total. I use my electric grinder because I don't worry about the extra fine bits that it creates and the Aeropress is so incredibly easy, fast and simple to clean. Pro-tip: you can rinse and reuse the filters many times over!
customer_reviews.author: TaCara

customer_reviews.title: Seems Like a Lot of Work for Coffee
customer_reviews.text: It makes coffee with a lot of loose parts and in the end you’ll be placing your cup of coffee in the microwave to reheat even before the 1st sip. This press has a lot of 5 star reviews and my friend recommended it but I just don’t get the ritual of making coffee via this system. My conclusion is after 4 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: RMW

customer_reviews.title: I prefer a French Press.
customer_reviews.text: I already have a glass coffee press, but some coffee expert told me this was better. It's not. The water runs through the grounds quickly, and I don't see an advantage to this over a traditional coffee press at all. In fact, I like the coffee press better. This is all plastic, cost too much for what it is, and not attractive, so I have to store it in the cabinet. I can display the French press. Just a personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: CozyChairReader

customer_reviews.title: Follow exact instructions
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with this coffee! But I've discovered that you really have to follow the exact instructions on the AeroPress website for a great cup of coffee. Even slight variations can make a difference and give you an ordinary result. I use a gooseneck kettle with thermometer in the top to ensure the right temperature. After you've made a few cups, it's easy-peasy. So much less work than a pour-over method and simple clean up.
customer_reviews.author: One More Time

customer_reviews.title: The best coffee at this price, maybe at 5-10x this price...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I love this thing. It makes the best coffee, smooth and strong. I was trying to recreate a machiatto, and my recipe is this: Plunger at 1. Fill with 2.25 scoops of coffee (between 2 an 3). Fill UPSIDE down with hot water, about 190 degrees, up to about 1/2 from the top. Stir. Let sit for 1.5 minutes, stir again. Heat some milk. At 3 minutes, put filter on, turn over on cup and plunge. Add equal parts warm whole milk... Sooo good, smooth and STRONG. I am using more coffee than I used to - drinking 3 of these a day, but it is so much better that I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Mjolnir. PMA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little coffee system
customer_reviews.text: I am the only coffee drinker in my house, so I've always used a single-cup coffee maker. I hate creating waste, so I had a Senseo for years. It was easy, the coffee was fine, and the only waste was a paper filter. Then my Senseo broke, so I decided to try this. I've had it for only a few weeks, but it's so easy, and the coffee is so much better (plus there's more variety since the Senseo pods only come in two flavors now). I'm very happy with this product. The only downside is that I'm probably drinking more coffee now. The senseo only makes little half cups, so it was great at keeping my consumption down.
customer_reviews.author: SheilaJG

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: We love the Aeropress! It's even better with a reusable filter. However, after a while (like 6-7 years) the plunger stops being able to effectively hold the coffee in before pressing. It's like it shrunk! Luckily, it's easily fixable by placing it in hot water for a bit (to make the rubber expand). You can purchase a new plunger for a fraction of the cost, however, our cylinder was starting to look a bit sad, cracked (?) so we ended up with a new set just in time for Christmas. This thing makes the best coffee all around, in the morning, on the road, camping, you name it! LOVE THE AEROPRESS!!!
customer_reviews.author: IndrOutdrGrl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Clean/Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Tastes more like french press than drip. Easy to clean. I love'd my french press until laziness prevailed. This is the solution. It is so easy to clean and makes a great cup of coffee. It doesn't fit into my travel mug. I think they were worried about tipping during pressing into a narrow tall mug. I like my Contigo travel mug because it's narrow and fits in my back pocket. I need to press this into a normal mug, then transfer over. I bought this to make coffee while on extended vacations living in the van. At home this isn't an issue. I will need to find a wider-mouth travel mug.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Herr

customer_reviews.title: What else is there to say?  It's the perfect way to make coffee with no bitterness.
customer_reviews.text: So, I never liked coffee all that much. I have a hard time with bitter, can't stand it. This changed my mind about coffee entirely. I had no idea coffee could taste, well, not like the bitter coffee I've been drinking my entire life. I now drink a cup of coffee every singe morning, using this amazing coffee maker. It cleans with a quick rinse as soon as you're done making your coffee. Takes easily under two minutes every morning to make a perfect cup of coffee. I'm never going back to using anything else. I can't say this about 99% of the things I buy, this $30 gadget has changed me life. I really mean that.
customer_reviews.author: Krishun

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Former french presser until I switched to a Keurig 2.0 for convenience. Got sick of the expensive stale tasting coffee, so I decided to get another french press, and then I came across the Aeropress. This is about the same price as a french press, and it had great reviews all over YouTube so I figured I'd give it a try. I'm definitely still learning, but it's pretty hard to make a bad cup of coffee when you combine freshly ground beans and a fully incorporated brew. Pros: -Cheap -Built to last (hard plastic, no glass) -More versatile than french press -Fun to interact with your coffee and tailor every aspect of it to your liking -Great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great cup of coffee, no hassle
customer_reviews.text: This device is my favorite. It isn't fancy and I love that because I am less afraid of it falling apart after spending a ton of money on an appliance. It is the cheapest coffee maker and honestly makes the best cup of coffee. I am okay with single use and this is my favorite way to have coffee. I bought a milk frother with this so I can get a latte at home.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: perfect for camping or travel
customer_reviews.text: i use my aeropress whenever i go on vacation or camping. i make coffee in my tent or outside of it with little fear of breaking my press. once i make coffee for the hotel clerk because he hated their coffee so much. i made it for myself for the same reason. basically i bought this for travel and camping. i wanted something similar to a french press but that wouldnt break easily, was easy to clean and made great coffee. my aeropress succeeded on all three points. teamed up with a reusable filter and a hand-crank bean grinder and my travel coffee need never suck again.
customer_reviews.author: Gojira Neko (godzilla cat)

customer_reviews.title: Loving it so far!
customer_reviews.text: Two weeks in of daily use and I love it! Much easier to clean than a French press, much easier to use than a stove top espresso maker, and the same difficulty as a so how cup drip coffee maker. Very satisfied with the quality of the coffee it produces! Rich full taste with way less bitterness than my mocha stovetop maker. Looking forward to bring this camping. Pairs great with my hand grinder for off the grid coffee making on a sailboat ⛵
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C. States

customer_reviews.title: Amazing $30 device will turn you into a coffee snob l. The difference in taste is night and day
customer_reviews.text: Received late yesterday so I used it for the 1st time this morning and had to write my review. Why people are only giving this product 4 stars is beyond me. If it gets lower than 4 stars its BS. Such an amazing, inexpensive, creative, innovative, compact product. If more of our American made products tooka page this country would be back in time with quality produced goods. I travel half a year and this is a game changer. I havent had a cup of coffee this good since visiting a cuban bakery in key largo. Ive had coffee from the most expensive machines from Puerto Rico to Texas all the way up to Colorado and east again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Hubs loves his coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He loves coffee and got introduced to the AeroPress and has never looked back! This is his second one. With the first one, the rubber was starting to dry out and didn’t hold a seal as well any more. It was at least three years old so I decided it was time to treat him to a new one since he uses it at least once a day.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L

customer_reviews.title: A friend introduced me to this and I've used it every since, love the taste of the coffee
customer_reviews.text: I hand grind my coffee and make two fresh cups each morning. I wash/reuse the filter until it gets hard to press out. Recently I read that well filtered coffee has some extra benefits for health so I have been using a cone filter as well. I really like the smoother flavor with twice filtered coffee. This is a great way to make a very fresh cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.author: sadsack

customer_reviews.title: We love this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I got teased for buying another gadget and now the whole family has converted to this coffee maker. It is easy, it is fast, the coffee has a sort of clear pure taste. It is the absolute best way to make a cup of coffee. We use our regular coffee pot in the morning so fights don't break out in the kitchen (ahem) but use the AeroPress for those extra cups throughout the day. I can't believe I was so slow to "find" this product. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: control...control..control is what I love about this single cup maker
customer_reviews.text: I can decide how much coffee...what grind..roast ...brand to use...unlike the Keurig-style..... There is no waste like in an old-fashioned coffee maker. I use both a metal & a paper filter to eliminate any coffee grounds getting into the cup. This also makes cleaning very easy as the paper filter holds the grounds in place for easy dumping.... Before this, I must have gone through 4 or 5 different single-cup machines ... as one expensive machine broke down, I would buy another. My last one site in a cupboard...dusty..unused for months. oh...and wonderful taste....
customer_reviews.author: OldBill

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Everyone I know had an Aeropress, so I had to try it out. I gotta say - This thing makes a solid cup of coffee. I typically use a Chemex, but the Aeropress gives a completely different flavor. The Aeropress is also very quick at making coffee and is easy to throw in a bag and take out on the go. The biggest downside is it doesn't make a lot of coffee. You can fill up a mug, but that's it. So, if you're making coffee for multiple people, or you need to fill a 20 oz thermos then this isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for camping, using it every day!
customer_reviews.text: The Aeropress makes a great cup of coffee, better than standard filter pour-over since you have precise control over how long the grinds are in the water. I purchased it to use for camping and backpacking, but I now use it every day instead of a pour-over type filter. Clean up is super easy, no messy grounds to rinse out since they just pop out with the plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Ted S

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but after 5 months of use the seal is loose and leaking. We take great care of the product and hand wash all the parts so I know it hasn't been warped from a dishwasher. I wonder if we got a defective item. A friend of ours has the same one and has owned it for a year and has none of these problems. I love the single serving of coffee but I'm afraid I won't buy this product again because of the seal. Such a shame because we loved it for the first few months.
customer_reviews.author: hfamily08

customer_reviews.title: Simple, small, confinement, flavorful coffee
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to clean: just pop out the coffee and filter. Don’t need the accessories that some reviewers are complaining about. 3 small pieces: the plunger (really like one part) and the water flow cap. The rest is all optional and not necessary for use. I’m buying a second one for home. First one is for our camper trailer, but I am using it instead of my large, cumbersome espresso machine which I have decided to give to my son. It’s nice to have extra counter space again! I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Denise W.

customer_reviews.title: not quite what i expected
customer_reviews.text: My aeropress didn't look like the one in the picture. Mine was opaque. Not a big deal, but not what I thought I was getting. I don't notice it making any better coffee than a regular french press after 9 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Athena G.

customer_reviews.title: consistent , reliable, reasonable, quality.  What more could you ask for.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this almost a year now, simple to use great cup of coffee everytime. I’m sorry I didn’t star sooner, I didn’t know coffee wasn’t suppose to taste bitter, curse you k-cups. If you grind your own beans it takes you up to higher level of coffee quality with this. Good beans, good grinder, good press can only lead to awsomenesssssss.
customer_reviews.author: Norman J.

customer_reviews.title: Revolutionized my coffee experience
customer_reviews.text: I never thought that it was possible to revolutionize the coffee experience... but Aeropress has done just that. I was a French press user for years. I got pretty used to the super-acidic nature of the French press due to leaving the coffee in the grounds all morning. The taste and reduced bitterness with the Aeropress is amazing. The cleanup is a dream and you can even use it in an office where you don't have a sink. On the downside, it does use a little more coffee than usual but the taste and strength are totally worth it. I've just about made it through my first set of filters (350?) and I'm looking forward to going through another set.
customer_reviews.author: Texifornia

customer_reviews.title: easy to use once you get the hang of it
customer_reviews.text: My family has been using a Keurig machine for the past several years and decided it was time to up our coffee game. This little tool is super easy to use once you get the hang of it (took us a couple tries), and tastes SIGNIFICANTLY better than our Keurig coffee. It is pretty easy to clean as well, and doesn't take up much space which is another plus. Definitely recommending this to our coffee-loving friends!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to use and clean, makes a great cup.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second aeropress and I absolutely love this product. It travels well and makes a great cup. I suggest discovering the inverted method of brewing as you’re able to keep your grounds steeping for longer. My wife and I used my first aeropress everyday for literally 5 Years and it stood strong. It’s now mretired to my job for when I need a dose of real coffee and not the company BS. Thes ease of use, cleanup and ability to make a great cup make this a buy it for life product for me.
customer_reviews.author: RaoulDuque

customer_reviews.title: Cleanup is easier than a Kureg!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I'm deployed to Afghanistan and making coffee can be a little difficult at times. There is a Kureg machine but we run out of pods or the machine breaks. The Aeropress makes a perfect cup of coffee in no time and the thing I like most about it is the cleanup. After you make the cup of coffee you just unscrew the bottom, the filter stays on the press, then press the plunger all the way through and the waste falls into the trash can. Wipe off the plunger and your done!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Kordenbrock

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one I own
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the aeropress! The coffee tastes great! Its perfect for traveling and making one cup of a coffee rather than a whole pot! Aeropress company has great customer service as well. Several of my filters in this package were cut weird and not usable. I emailed Aeropress, and they happily sent me a whole new pack of replacement filters quickly. I would highly recommend the aeropress to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Ilove2giggle95

customer_reviews.title: Makes an exceptional cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I use this every morning, and wouldn't trade it for all the pod makers in the world. It makes bad coffee taste good, according to my neighbor who turned me on to this. But I use great coffee, grind it, put it in this, follow the instructions, and can make a cup and clean it, put it away, and all in 10 minutes, including grinding and dusting out the grinder. No waste; the filters can be reused many times; I probably replace the filter once a month.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Garber

customer_reviews.title: This is the way to make coffee!
customer_reviews.text: The Aeropress has a bit of a cult following, and it can seem overwhelming when you read about the "best" way to make coffee. Just know that making it according to the instructions will give you a great, reich cup of coffee. The one thing to know is that this can be a messy way to make coffee as well, mainly from forcing the used grounds out of the device. Be sure to do it in a way that you don't splash your walls and furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Nepon-sixt

customer_reviews.title: My favorite (and best tasting) method of making coffee EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to purchase an AeroPress sooner after Tim Ferriss recommended it but I kept putting it off. When my French press glass carafe got chipped, I finally ordered the AeroPress. Wish I had sooner! The AeroPress method is quicker than using a French press and SO MUCH EASIER TO CLEAN! Seriously, you just plunge out the spent coffee grinds into the trash and rinse off the parts when you're done. And the taste is the best and easiest to replicate out of any method I've tried. For speed and taste, can't go wrong with the AeroPress!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Lasts years. Company improves between models.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought lasted me 2-3 years. The second one I've had for a year and it's not showing any signs of wear so far. They made the plunger head thicker and I think the walls of the outer plastic are thicker too. Usually products get worse and not better, so great job Aerobie. As far as flavor, it's a coffee maker, if you put in good beans and use the right temps of water it'll come out as good as any other coffee maker. They're all the same. It's remarkably easy to clear though.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Ben

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've had one for years and bought this newer version as a gift. Delicious coffee without bitterness. Some people think it can't make more than one cup of coffee at a time but that's not how it's supposed to work. Use the Aeropress to make a small, concentrated dose of coffee, similar to a syrup, and then dilute as desired. When I do want to bring out more bitterness in my coffee, I just let the grounds steep a few minutes before plunging air through.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It's the best of both a poor over and a French press! The coffee tastes cleaner, fresh and more robust. Very easy to use and clean. Hack: if you want to mimick a French press just add all your water then insert the plunger, push down slightly then pull up just a bit not allowing the plunger to come out of course. This stops the flow and allows the coffee to steep like in a press! When you're ready just continue pressing down like normal.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Simply The Best
customer_reviews.text: I read a blog post that compared this to espresso machines, pour overs, moka pots, drip machines, etc. The authors said this was the best, so I had to try it out. And they were right!!! I consistently produce smooth, rich coffee with mine, and you can be as hands-on with it as you'd like to be! It's easy to customize your brew in so many ways (temperature, time, pressure, grind size, etc.). At this price, you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of homemade coffee I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I was accustomed to the poor taste of drip coffee for a long time. But you grin and bear it because its the cheapest and fastest way to get your fix. But when I tried this press at a friend's house I was blown away. It tasted like something you'd get at a high end cafe. The setup is a little kooky; very different than a set it and forget it drip system or a french press. But once you get use to the ritual and sit down to your cup of coffee, you'll be wondering how you ever forced yourself to drink stank drip coffee for so long. Great invention!
customer_reviews.author: M. S.

customer_reviews.title: this Aeropress makes the ULTIMATE in a great tasting brew
customer_reviews.text: If starting with properly roasted coffee beans, ground as directed by Aeropress, using fresh (good tasting) water, this Aeropress makes the ULTIMATE in a great tasting brew. So simple-- so expedient-- so earth friendly. To make it even more so, I added a stainless steel micro-filter to my kit (even though this comes with paper filters that do quite well) The "Able Brewing Disk Coffee Filter" available here on Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: MindfulShopper

customer_reviews.title: What An Ingenious Device!
customer_reviews.text: If you like espresso, but don't want to spend a couple of hundred dollars for a machine, this ingenious device will do the job. Easy to use and very affordable. I use it to make an occasional mocha at home. Had a French Press for this purpose before, but it didn't suit this purpose at all, and was a real pain to use. The Aero Press blew the French Press out of the water for ease of use and taste. My gf has an expensive Nespresso machine. This simple little Aero Press device does almost as good of a job for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: great for road trips
customer_reviews.text: I love this item, great for travel. I went on a trip to an Air BnB and I asked in advance. only an old fashioned drip coffee maker. If you like coffee, this is not acceptable. Aeropress to the rescue. I bought and loved it. I ground up some nice beans, put in a plastic bag and voila, gourmet coffee every morning. Follow directions it's as easy as 1.2.3. Easy to clean too. I even like to make the coffee this way at home sometimes for no particular reason, just tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Amy

customer_reviews.title: Skip Dunkies
customer_reviews.text: My go-to coffee maker. It saves me a ton of cash as I can skip Dunkies now. Reusable filters, easy clean, small footprint make this a winner for people who RV. I take it when I travel so I do not have to drink the execrable coffee in hotels. I use the in-room coffee maker or microwave or free breakfast to heat water. This is french press coffee without the mud and grit. Coarse grind your own beans to keep the filter easy to press thru.
customer_reviews.author: TToka

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Produces a damn good cup of coffee! The only possible thing that I see which might become a possible problem in the near future would be the rubber end which pushes through the tube. It looks like it's going to rip off when I start pushing it through the tube. Hasn't yet, but only time will tell. Like I said, great cup of Joe! Just mess with the measurements a bit until you find the right amount to suit your taste, and you will be on cloud 9!
customer_reviews.author: Radsan

customer_reviews.title: Easy quick cup for beginners, customizable for the most demanding experts!
customer_reviews.text: Makes an incredible cup of coffee. Easy to use. Easy to customize your cup - change water temperature, grind size, time of brew, water:grinds ratio - until you get it just right! Tip - Lower temperatures and shorter brew times with a finer grind can lead to a beautifully sweet brew. Tip 2 - Inversion brewing gives you complete control!! No coffee lost before it’s ready. Tip 3 - Each type of bean & level of roast will do better with little tweaks to your brew method of choice!
customer_reviews.author: DJDM

customer_reviews.title: Makes brewing coffee fun again!
customer_reviews.text: The infamous Aeropress! Truly an amazing coffee machine in a small form factor. I originally purchase for traveling and camping, but find myself using it more and more at home. The included recipe wasn’t the best for me, so I recommend trying and tweaking others based on your beans and preferences - the upside down technique is best. All in all, this makes brewing coffee the amazing ritual it can be and not just a chore.
customer_reviews.author: K. Osman

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, but wears out.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas and enjoyed the coffee I got out of it. Followed all instructions, including not letting the gasket sit inside the chamber in order to prolong its life. However, by July the gasket was popping off when I disassembled the press for cleaning. I know they sell replacement gaskets, but I think the original should be able to take more than seven months of light to moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Rethink your coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've made coffee with a standard auto drip machine, pour-over, French press, cold brew, and now the AeroPress. While it's slightly less convenient than the auto machines, the flavor and speed with which you can have a delicious cup of coffee with the AeroPress can't be beat, and the cleanup is incredibly easy compared to a French press. While it doesn't make true espresso, it is close enough without spending hundreds of dollars on a machine, especially if you're using it to make lattes, cappuccinos, etc. If you plan on using it to make multiple cups at a time, buy a graduated steel milk frothing cup that the AeroPress will rest on and make your life a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: It is better tha a French Press, previously my preferred method. It combines the best aspects of the drip method, and the press method. It is easy to make coffee too strong, so easy up on the measures and be sure to use fine grounds, as per drip. Easy to clean and put away. When I run out of paper filters, I might try the fine mesh metal filter. Do not leave hot water over long with grounds, less than one minute is sufficient for an excellent brew.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Duckmanton

customer_reviews.title: So Cool!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after reading about it from a money saving blogger, he said he was tempted to buy a fancy $700 machine! But did a little research and discovered that: A) This made great coffee just as well as the expensive machine. B) It takes up little to no room. C) You can easily travel with it (and save on hotel coffee). D) It takes 30 seconds to clean. What's not to love!
customer_reviews.author: Ms London

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This makes the best cup of coffee and espresso shots!!!! Better than my $500 espresso maker! Skip the expensive machines and just go with this portable, no electricity or batteries needed, awesome product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Flanegan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Someone at work told me about this and I’m glad I tried it. Makes a pretty decent substitute for espresso. I actually prefer it over espresso at most places. Honestly I use this or my moka pot 90% of the time now. Moka pot makes a better espresso/coffee but also takes much longer and is less versatile than the aero press. The aero press does take a little trial and error to get everything on point since there is so many variables. I noticed the largest quality difference had to do with steep and press time. The directions are a solid starting point though. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Picky coffee drinker likes this.
customer_reviews.text: This makes a great cup of coffee. You decide how strong you want it. I like strong coffee and had a hard time finding a coffee maker that satisfied me. This press does the job. It only makes one cup at a time. That’s great for just me in the morning, but not for a larger gathering. It’s similar to a French Press but so much faster. After you heat the water, coffee is ready in about thirty seconds. Pushing the plunger down takes a little force. I’m pretty sure my 80 year old Mom couldn’t do it. Super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Carmel

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long????
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at the Aeropress for years and for some reason, it's taken me this long to actually buy it. I should have done this years ago! Best damn cup of coffee I've ever produced at home, and it's ridiculously easy to make, and even more ridiculously easy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Goddessecouture

customer_reviews.title: Make a great 2 oz cup of espresso
customer_reviews.text: Make a great shot of espresso But I wish it would tell me how any ounces were per servingin the instructions.So I made a sample serving to find out. I have did it just using Folgers Classic Roast and it made 2 ounces
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: makes coffee the hard way
customer_reviews.text: This invention will produce a good cup of coffee if you get all the details right each time. Add in the necessary instant-read thermometer and the Pyrex measuring cup for heating the water and it looks like a chemistry set on my kitchen counter. A few minutes of careful attention to detail yields a cup about equal to a pour-over. I later bought a good small-serving automatic drip machine that makes the same coffee for much less hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Mr and Mrs Williams

customer_reviews.title: Tasty coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our RV but have been using it at home. It took a few tries to get it right, but now it's quick and easy. If you like americano, they say to add water after it's brewed. I just fill the container to the 4 mark and it's perfect. Love the little filters. I try to avoid plastic as much as possible but make an exception for this. If there's a metal or glass version, I'd be all in.
customer_reviews.author: Barb B

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Expected more flavor.
customer_reviews.text: Read something, somewhere about how good these are. Best cup of coffee for the money, like discovering coffee over again, blah, blah, blah. I have used it several times and tried different approaches to find that dark, rich, flavorful promise land. No such luck. Don't get me wrong, it's a good cup of coffee but there's a lot of hype in the aftertaste.
customer_reviews.author: BeardedDogs

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: I saw these for years in friends' kitchens and camping gear, and dismissed them assuming they were some kind of gimmicky camping coffeemaker. Then I read more about them, tried one myself, and now it's the majority of my coffee making. Quick, super easy to clean, consistent, adaptable for various taste and strength desires. Just a really cool product that is so much more than it appears.
customer_reviews.author: J. PearsonTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: It's A No Brainer
customer_reviews.text: All the hundreds over the years spent on coffee machines, this gadget paramounts the lot. Perfect smooth tasting coffee every time. I actually watched a UK consumer show where they had 4 different coffee makers, one started at over $3000,and the cheapest being this one. With the blind fold test, some coffee critic did not believe it was the Aeropress that made the best coffee. Theres loads of YT videos that describe the process, i myself prefer the "Inverted" method of making the cup of Joe. I'm not being paid to preview this, its my own preview. Just make sure no boiling water is used. I separately purchased a $40 kettle with temperature control,
customer_reviews.author: M. F

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding me?
customer_reviews.text: I guess I am not enough of a coffee snob to appreciate the time and effort the aeropress requires to get a cup of coffee that did not taste one bit different than my cheap easy to use Mr. Coffee. Taking a hit on shipping to return.... that's how sure I am that I will never use this thing again.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: My favorite coffee maker to date
customer_reviews.text: After my trip to Italy, I was desperate for good, strong "cafe," but I wasn't willing to pay $$$ for an espresso maker. I am so glad I found the areopress...what a great design! It has become my daily coffee maker for the past several months, and makes a fantastic strong cup of coffee. I do bend the rules a bit: I heat my water to boiling (I like REALLY hot coffee) and I use about 1 tbsp/per number on the side of the carafe piece. Play with it a bit, it took me a few tries to find out what I liked. But for me to use it DAILY it was really worth the effort and purchase!
customer_reviews.author: dragosgirl

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy. It makes a really nice cup of coffee. There is a ritual to making each cup, with several steps and a little waiting, but I think it’s worth it. I like that I could travel with it. I also like that I can reuse the little filters many times before changing them out.
customer_reviews.author: Hmm

customer_reviews.title: They change the plastic and ruined it.
customer_reviews.text: I have two aeropresses. (Well, three but one exploded trying to push water through coffee that was ground too fine. But that was my fault.) The old one is a harder more transparent plastic and has lasted years with daily use. The new one is a softer less transparent plastic. The rubber seal on the plunger catches on this softer plastic and is breaking down. If you look in the tube you will find little pieces of rubber. As much as I love my old aeropress, I can't recommend the new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Clements

customer_reviews.title: The cheapest, best tasting coffee maker that I have eve tried, highly recommended for any coffee lovers!
customer_reviews.text: The Ultimate cup of coffee, completed controlled by you from start to finish. Be the mad scientist you've always wanted to be by experimenting with different coffees to find the ultimate flavor of coffee that suits you. Also,check out Bullet Proof coffee, same setup but you add Irish grass fed butter and a bit of MCT oil to the mixture to help give you sustained energy and clarity throughout your busy day. It's quite cheap and tastes so much better than S.Bucks. I actually own 2 of them, I hop you decide o give these manual coffee makers a shot, you will thank me later!
customer_reviews.author: Adam B. Bugay

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly makes coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing goofy looking instant french press. It uses a coin paper filter. Never any grinds in my cup. And just about any coffee comes out smoother, stronger, better. It just works! Cleanup is basically eject the used coffee and filter, one push into a waste basket. Wipe of any residue on the plunger. That's it. I love this stupid looking thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mc

customer_reviews.title: Makes an absolutely delicious cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I will say first, I watched a few videos from the inventor himself on how to properly use this produce. YouTube university, as always, is fantastic. I absolutely love this coffee maker. It makes for as strong or as weak of coffee as you'd like. No bitterness and the coffee does not upset my stomach as the French Press coffee does. I'm a lifer!
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have used a french press for many years, I like my coffee dark and full of flavor. After I got my Aeropress... on the recommendations of others who really like coffee as well... it helped to go to the Aeropress website and watch the tutorials on how to make a great cup of coffee. After adjusting the grind, soak time, and coffee beans... I now enjoy a fantastic cup of coffee every time! The downside... it makes one cup of coffee. The upside: it is a delicious cup of coffee and the clean up is really fast!
customer_reviews.author: MRO

customer_reviews.title: Love the aeropress, always have
customer_reviews.text: Love the aeropress, used to for almost a decade, finallyneeded to replace it. My husband doesn't drink coffee so I only need a cup at a time. I like that I can make a fresh single cup with this. With the aeropress coffee grounds dont sit making it too strong and making acidity levels high. I stopped drinking coffee before my friend introduced me to this.
customer_reviews.author: June McCallum

customer_reviews.title: Still great, albeit not 100%
customer_reviews.text: My previous aeropress survived nearly 10 years of daily coffee making. They’ve changed the plastic and it feels a little cheaper and I’m not sure how long it’ll last. Also, the stand was warped and ended up using the previous one’s. The stand that came from this one was completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Knudson

customer_reviews.title: Brews a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to a previous review. After thinking more about this coffee brewer I find it is better described as a combination of a Melitta type filter brewer and a French Press. It includes features of both. It produces as great cup of coffee efficiently with a method that is both easy to use and easy to clean up. It comes with a nice supply of filters, enough to last a while. In my opinion, it's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Love my Aeropress
customer_reviews.text: The aeropress is fantastic and can make a consistently great cup of coffee. It's a pain that to avoid some coffee leaking through too early you need to invert or rush to get the plunger in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Mug ‘o Joe
customer_reviews.text: This contraption makes the best coffee I’ve ever had, hands down. I like a full-bodied brew, and the Aero Press achieves that without the bitterness of a strongly brewed pot. I’m not someone who has the space for a dedicated espresso machine, nor the funds. This works fantastically. I strongly suggest hitting YouTube for some instructions on use as the instructions included in the packaging are not great. I’ve found that the perfect mug for me is one Aero brew, topped off by regular pot-coffee. I adore this thing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vedro

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a while and I must say I loved it! I have never liked French Press, despite trying different types of beans, because of the bitter taste and I was nervous that this will result in similar taste but no, the coffee just tastes amazing; I guess this is related to the usage of a paper filter. Besides, it is super quick to brew and easy to clean, you can prepare your coffee just under 2 mins, including boiling water, brewing coffee, and cleaning. As a side note, I reuse the paper filter by washing it after every use (reused 5-10 times) and had no problem so far. I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dgoreke

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, small volume, java maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great invention. I have tried it all. French press, percolators, drip, u name it. As I get older I drink less volume but still relish good taste. This is the answer. I use it regular and inverted and like both. Still tweaking my burr grinder but already happy with flavor. Super small footprint and I compost the waste. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: appgap

customer_reviews.title: My new fave
customer_reviews.text: My wife told me that coffee makers that use a paper filter are better for your health. So I stopped using my Moka pot and started using the Aeropress. I heat 250ml of water for 99 seconds in the microwave and make enough coffee for two days. I drink one strong cup of latte in the morning. Strong brew and really great flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hawthorn Binkley

customer_reviews.title: South Indian Filter Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've always drinking south Indian filter coffee at friends home and crave that sometimes. I looked at that steel container and wanted to consolidate with espresso, French, cold brew etc. Got the aeropress for my Bday and am making filler coffee since then. Makes 4 cups of small cups (as it should be served)
customer_reviews.author: Rushkami

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make delicious Teeccino
customer_reviews.text: I was super impressed with all of the reviews about how well this makes coffee. I really wanted to know if it would work on my Teeccino herbal coffee, though. I only found one review that mentioned it, but I decided to try it out. I am so glad I did! It is by far the best method of brewing my Teeccino that I have tried. The flavor really comes through perfectly. It is so quick and easy, and so simple to clean up. I am very happy I decided to get an Aeropress!
customer_reviews.author: Caity

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. Looking forward to tomorrow’s cups.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised. Clever idea. Bit skeptical but worked as described. The coffee it made was much more pleasant than the Keurig capsules I have used for years. The #2 marker is about half a cup - could. Have added water but tasted it and decided it was fine. Cleaning was easy but will get a washable filter.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwiruss

customer_reviews.title: Good but not life changing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for backpacking based on reviews and comments from other backpackers. I love a good cup of coffee and this was touted as the very best. It does make a good cup of coffee but I didn't find it any better than my GSI pour-over filter. This was much heavier and more trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Swampfox

customer_reviews.title: Two parts do not match.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two AeroPress coffee maker. The first one was perfect. However, the second one does not function properly. The two parts of the coffee maker--plunger and camber--do not match in size. The plunger is smaller! Every time I use the coffee maker and when I push, liquid leak up from below the plunger. It makes a mess every time!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I’m a convert
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of these until I broke my French press. I’m a convert. Makes the least bitter cup of coffee possible from the same beans. All I use now.
customer_reviews.author: Orlandoguy82

customer_reviews.title: It is indeed, all that!
customer_reviews.text: I had been a long time French press person for years but about the wastefulness of this method and I hate the length of time to brew in those challenging mornings. I just have my first Aeropress cuppa and it is wonderful! I brew Ruta Maya organic dark roast, freshly ground and it never taste so rich. The only thing I would change I would want a model one made of glass. I know it is free of phthalates, bisphenol-A and BPA analogs but I love the purity of glass.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom Now

customer_reviews.title: Good for a Quick, Single Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is nice system for a quick single cup of coffee. I've tried a few different recipes now, and with the exception of "espresso" it's worked pretty good. I saw a few espresso-style recipes, but I could never find a good grind size that worked. It was either too fine to be able to press or too course to mimic espresso. I use a decent Capresso burr grinder, but maybe it's still on me. Either way, the product is 5-star for what I intended to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee. Pretty easy to get used to.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a much smoother tasting coffee than a drip coffeemaker. I use at least a couple of times almost every day. Eventually will wear out, but lasts a long, long time. Works best with a 16oz travel mug. Not sure I personally would like it so much with a regular coffee cup, but to each their own.
customer_reviews.author: S2G

customer_reviews.title: Stronger flavour profile than French Press
customer_reviews.text: Much stronger flavour profile than using a french press. Easy to use - just pop in a filter, ground coffee, water, and press the plunger in. Love that there's a measure spoon and a mixer included. I still can't really figure out where we need that funnel thing, I don't actually use that part. The only complaint I'd have is volume - you can only make one cup at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality, the best travel coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful coffee maker. I use it for backpacking and pretty much everywhere I go. It’s easy to compact and also better lasting than any electronic coffee maker. It comes with really specific step by step instructions on how to upkeep it and it works amazing over time. I’ve had mine for 4 years and it’s still going strong. Really easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Williams

product_meta.title: AeroPress Coffee and Espresso Maker - Quickly Makes Delicious Coffee Without Bitterness - 1 to 3 Cups Per Pressing
product_meta.description: Popular with coffee enthusiasts worldwide, the patented AeroPress is a new kind of coffee press that uses a rapid, total immersion brewing process to make smooth, delicious, full flavored coffee without bitterness and with low acidity. Good-bye French Press! The rapid brewing AeroPress avoids the bitterness and high acidity developed during the long steep time required by the French press. Plus, the AeroPress paper Microfilter eliminates grit and means clean up takes seconds. Makes 1 to 3 cups of American coffee per pressing in about a minute, and unlike a French press, it can also brew espresso style coffee for use in lattes, cappuccinos and other espresso based drinks. Perfect for home kitchen use, the AeroPress is lightweight, compact, portable and durable, making it also ideal for traveling, camping, backpacking, boating and more! Includes the AeroPress press, funnel, scoop, stirrer, 350 microfilters and a filter holder. Mug not included. Assembled measurements: 9 1/2" h X 4" w X 4" d
feature_bullets: Popular with coffee enthusiasts worldwide, the patented AeroPress is a new kind of coffee press that uses a rapid, total immersion brewing process to make smooth, delicious, full flavored coffee without bitterness and with low acidity.

Good-bye French Press! The rapid brewing AeroPress avoids the bitterness and high acidity created by the long steep time required by the French press. Plus, the AeroPress paper Microfilter eliminates grit and means clean up takes seconds.
Makes 1 to 3 cups of American coffee per pressing in about a minute, and unlike a French press, it can also brew espresso style coffee for use in lattes, cappuccinos and other espresso based drinks.
Perfect for home kitchen use, the AeroPress is lightweight, compact, portable and durable, making it also ideal for traveling, camping, backpacking, boating and more!
Includes the AeroPress press, funnel, scoop, stirrer, 350 microfilters and a filter holder. Phthalate free and BPA free. Mug not included. Assembled measurements: 9 1/2" h X 4" w X 4" d

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars8,699 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Paddle, Aeropress Coffee And Espresso Maker
